description: A large macaw that is predominantly olive green, with a bright red patch on its forehead, blue flight feathers, and a red and blue tail. Its name comes from its uniform-like green plumage.
temperament: Intelligent, inquisitive, and can be quite friendly and even-tempered with good socialization. They can be mischievous and require consistent training.
loudness: Very Loud. They have a loud, grating screech that they will use often, especially in the morning and evening.
vocalization: Good talkers, capable of learning many words and phrases with reasonable clarity.
dietaryNeeds: A standard macaw diet of high-quality pellets, supplemented with a variety of fruits, vegetables, and nuts.
healthPointers: Generally a hardy species with a lifespan of 50-60 years. They can be prone to the common macaw ailments such as PDD and psittacosis.
housing: Requires a large, durable cage of at least 36"W x 48"D x 60"H. Their loud vocalizations make them unsuitable for apartment living.
